newsitem.title: USA: National Semi sold out of 100MB ethernet.
newsitem.headline: National Semi sold out of 100MB ethernet.

text.p: National Semiconductor Corp has sold out of 100 megabit Ethernet LAN networking chips, a product in which it is market leader, its chief financial officer said Monday.

Chief Financial Officer Donald Macleod said National sees bright 1997 opportunities in the Ethernet LAN, wireless communications and consumer markets, adding that demand is so strong for the Ethernet chip that the product is sold out.
Macleod said at a Robertson, Stephens & Co conference that National also expects the closing of the sale of its Fairchild Semiconductor unit to occur in four to six weeks.

National will invest proceeds from the $550 million sale of Fairchild in "agressively putting together infrastructure" to lead in its remaining businesses of chips for communications and consumer systems, personal systems and analog and mixed-signal products, he said.
This fiscal year National will spend $360 million on research and development and $550 million to $575 million on new chip fabrication capacity, Macleod said.
He said the company is making major steps in re-focussing towards making application-specific chips and systems-on-a-chip for the communications, consumer, personal systems and analog markets.
